source_sentence: 其後健陀羅國迦膩色迦王，如來滅後第四百年，因脇尊者請諸聖眾，內窮三藏、外達五明者，
translation: Then, in the fourth hundred years after the nirvana of the Tathāgata, the king Kaniṣka of Gandhāra invited the holy monks who had mastered the Tripiṭaka and the five supernatural knowledges to his monastery.

source_sentence: 得四百九十九人，及尊者世友，合五百賢聖於此結集三藏。
translation: He obtained the Tripiṭaka of the Three Treasures compiled here by four hundred and ninety-nine people, including Venerable Vasumitra, together with five hundred sages and saints.

source_sentence: 先造十萬頌《鄔波第鑠論》(舊曰《優波提舍》，訛也)釋《素呾纜藏》(舊曰《修多羅》，
translation: He had previously composed the 100,000 verses of the Upāsaka Treatise (formerly transcribed as Upāsikā in error) to explain the sūtra collection of scriptures (formerly transcribed as sūtra).

source_sentence: 訛也)。
translation: It's also a mistake.)

source_sentence: 次造十萬頌《毘柰耶毘婆沙論》，釋《毘柰耶藏》(舊曰《毘耶》，訛也)。
translation: Next, he composed the 100,000 verses of the Vinaya-vibhāṣā-śāstra and explained the Vinaya collection (formerly transcribed incorrectly as Vaiśya).

source_sentence: 次造十萬頌《阿毘達磨毘婆沙論》，釋《阿毘達磨藏》(或曰《阿毘曇》，
translation: Next, he composed the Abhidharma-vibhāṣā-śāstra in 100,000 stanzas to explain the Abhidharma store (also called the Abhidharmakośa).

source_sentence: 訛也)。
translation: It's also a mistake.)

source_sentence: 凡三十萬頌，九十六萬言。
translation: The work consists of thirty million stanzas in all, measuring ninety-six million words.

source_sentence: 王以赤銅為鍱，鏤寫論文，石函封記，建大窣堵波而儲其中，命藥叉神守護。
translation: The king carved the text of the treatise in red copper and transcribed it into a stone casket for safekeeping. A large stupa was built to store the work, which was guarded by the yakṣa deity.

source_sentence: 奧義重明，此之力也。
translation: The mysterious meaning is repeatedly clarified, which is the power of this.

source_sentence: 如是停留首尾二年，學諸經、論，禮聖跡已，乃辭出。
translation: Thus the Master stayed in this monastery for two years, studying various scriptures and commentaries. After paying his respects to the holy sites he departed.

source_sentence: 西南逾涉山澗，行七百里，至半笯(奴故)嗟國。
translation: Going southwest for seven hundred li over a mountain valley, the Master reached the country of Parnasna (formerly known as Yucatan in olden times).

source_sentence: 從此東南行四百餘里，至遏邏闍補羅國(北印度境)。
translation: From here going southeast for more than four hundred li, I reached the country of Rājapura (in the domain of northern India).

source_sentence: 從此東南下山渡水行七百餘里，至礫迦國(北印度境)。
translation: From here going southeast for more than seven hundred li from the lower part of the mountain and crossing water, I reached the country of Kuka (in the domain of northern India).

source_sentence: 自藍波至於此土，其俗既住邊荒，儀服語言稍殊印度，有鄙薄之風焉。
translation: From Lampā up to this land, the people lived in frontier and deserted countries. Their etiquette and language differed slightly from those of India but they had a coarse and mean manner.

source_sentence: 自出曷邏闍補羅國，經三日，渡栴達羅婆伽河(此云月分)，到闍耶補羅城，
translation: Three days after leaving the country of Rājapura, he crossed the Ganges and reached the city of Jayapura.

source_sentence: 宿於外道寺。
translation: He spent the night at a non-Buddhist temple.

source_sentence: 寺在城西門外，是時徒侶二十餘人。
translation: The monastery was located outside the west gate of the city, with more than twenty monks in attendance.

source_sentence: 後日進到奢羯羅城，城中有伽藍，僧徒百餘人，昔世親菩薩於中製《勝義諦論》。
translation: On the following day he proceeded to the city of Śākala, where there was a monastery with over one hundred monks. Formerly Vasubandhu Bodhisattva composed the Abhidharmapuṇḍarīka-śāstra in this monastery.

source_sentence: 其側有窣堵波，高二百尺，是過去四佛說法之處，見有經行遺跡。
translation: Beside it is a stupa two hundred feet high, built at the place where the four past buddhas preached the Dharma.

source_sentence: 從此出那羅僧訶城，東至波羅奢大林中，逢群賊五十餘人，法師及伴所將衣資劫奪都盡，
translation: From here he came out of the city of Nārasāṃkhya and went eastward to the great forest of Vārāṇasī, where he met more than fifty bandits. The Master and his companions were all robbed of their clothing and belongings by thieves.

source_sentence: 仍揮刀驅就道南枯池，欲總屠害。
translation: They still raised their swords and drove off to the dried-up pond south of the road, intending to slaughter them all.

source_sentence: 其池多有蓬棘蘿蔓，法師所將沙彌遂映刺林，見池南岸有水穴，堪容人過，
translation: The pond was full of luxuriant thorns and grapes. All the novices whom the Master had brought to the pond were reflected in the bramble forest. On the southern bank of the pond he saw a well- drained moat that could accommodate any number of travelers.

source_sentence: 私告法師，師即相與透出。
translation: They privately told the Master, who then gave them to him and passed away.

source_sentence: 東南疾走可二三里，遇一婆羅門耕地，告之被賊，彼聞驚愕，即解牛與法師，
translation: Going southeast for about two or three li, he came upon a brahman who was plowing the land. He told him to be caught by thieves. They were startled when they heard this and immediately released the ox and gave it to the Master.

source_sentence: 向村吹貝，聲鼓相命，得八十餘人，各將器仗，急往賊所。
translation: The shells were blown in the direction of the village, and their voices and drums killed each other. More than eighty soldiers were captured but they all quickly went to the thief’s place with weapons and grenades.

source_sentence: 賊見眾人，逃散各入林間。
translation: Seeing the crowd, the thief fled and scattered into the forest.

source_sentence: 法師遂到池解眾人縛，又從諸人施衣分與，相携投村宿。
translation: The Master then went to the pond and released the people from their bonds, gave them their robes as alms, and fled together into the village for the night.

source_sentence: 諸人悲泣，獨法師笑無憂慼。
translation: The people wept in sorrow, and the Master alone smiled with no sorrow or pity.

source_sentence: 同侶問曰：「行路衣資賊掠俱盡，唯餘性命，僅而獲存。
translation: The companions asked, “All the thieves and robbers who traveled on the road lost their clothes and belongings. All that remained was their vitality; only a small part survived.

source_sentence: 困弊艱危，理極於此，所以却思林中之事，不覺悲傷。
translation: Because of the great danger of poverty and hardship, he thought only of what happened in the forest without feeling sorrow or pity.

source_sentence: 法師何因不共憂之，倒為欣笑？」
translation: What's the reason the teacher of the Dharma isn't sad and doesn't share it with him, which is to say that he's happy and smiling?

source_sentence: 答曰：「居生之貴，唯乎性命。
translation: He answered, The only thing that's valued in living is its nature and life.

source_sentence: 性命既在，餘何所憂。
translation: Since my life is still in existence, what else should I worry about?

source_sentence: 故我土俗書云：『天地之大德曰生。』
translation: That's why my native book says, 'The great virtue of heaven and earth is birth.'

source_sentence: 生之既在，則大寶不亡。
translation: Once it is born, the great treasure won’t perish.

source_sentence: 小小衣資，何足憂悋。」
translation: What's the point of worrying about small clothing and necessities?

source_sentence: 由是徒侶感悟。
translation: Because of this, the disciples were enlightened.

source_sentence: 其澄陂之量，渾之不濁如此。
translation: The depth of the river is so great that it doesn't pollute as much as this.

source_sentence: 明日到礫迦國東境，至一大城。
translation: On the next day he reached the eastern border of the country of Kauśika and arrived at a big city.

source_sentence: 城西道北有大菴羅林，林中有一七百歲婆羅門，及至觀之，可三十許，
translation: To the north of the road to the west of the city there was a great mango grove, in which lived a seventy-hundred-year-old brahman and his attendants, some thirty paces in all.

source_sentence: 質狀魁梧，神理淹審，明《中》、《百》諸論，善《吠陀》等書。
translation: He was an outstanding scholar in both the Mahayana and Hinayana scriptures, well versed in all the theories of the Mahayana and Hinayana teachings.

source_sentence: 有二侍者，各百餘歲。
translation: There were two attendants, each more than a hundred years old.

source_sentence: 法師與相見，延納甚歡。
translation: When the Master met with them, Yanna was overjoyed.

source_sentence: 又承被賊，即遣一侍者，命城中信佛法人，令為法師造食。
translation: In response to the thief's arrival, he sent an attendant and ordered a faithful Buddhist practitioner in the city to prepare food for the Master.

source_sentence: 其城有數千戶，信佛者蓋少，宗事外道者極多。
translation: The city had several thousand families living in it. Few of them believed in the Buddha but there were a great many heretics who practiced non-Buddhist theories.

source_sentence: 法師在迦濕彌羅時，聲譽已遠，諸國皆知，其使乃遍城中告唱云：「支那國僧來，
translation: When the Master was staying at Kaśmīra, his fame spread far and wide. All the kingdoms of the various countries knew about him. The envoy went to the city and called out in all the cities, “The monks from China are coming.

source_sentence: 近處被賊，衣服總盡，諸人宜共知時。」
translation: It's a good idea for everyone to know when they're about to be robbed by thieves and their clothes are all gone.

source_sentence: 福力所感，遂使邪黨革心，有豪傑等三百餘人，聞已各將斑[疊*毛]布一端，
translation: As a result of the power of blessedness, they caused the minds of the heretics to change their ways. There were more than three hundred men of great virtue and so forth. On hearing this, each wore a patch of white cotton cloth around his neck.

source_sentence: 并奉飲食，恭敬而至，俱積於前，拜跪問訊。
translation: They also offered food and drink to the Master, who approached them with veneration. All the offerings were piled up in front of him, bowed their heads and kneels, and greeted him.

source_sentence: 法師為呪願，并說報應因果，令諸人等皆發道意，棄邪歸正，相對笑語舞躍而還。
translation: The Master made a vow of incantations and explained the causes and effects of retribution, causing everyone to give rise to the intention for enlightenment, abandoned what was wrong and returned to what was right. They faced each other with laughter, talked, danced, and flew back.

source_sentence: 長年歎未曾有。
translation: For a long time, he praised it as unprecedented.

source_sentence: 於是以[疊*毛]布分給諸人，各得數具衣直，猶用之不盡，以五十端布奉施長年。
translation: He then distributed the cloth of cotton cloth to the people and gave it to them, each with a number of robes and straight pieces of cloth, but he didn't use them all; he gave fifty pieces of cloth to Changnian as alms.

source_sentence: 仍就停一月，學《經百論》、《廣百論》。
translation: He stayed there for one month to study the scriptures of the Hundred Treatises and the extensive treatises of the Hundred Treatises.

source_sentence: 其人是龍猛弟子，親得師承，說甚明淨。
translation: That man was a disciple of Nāgârjuna, who had personally attained the master's inheritance and explained it with great clarity and purity.

source_sentence: 又從此東行五百餘里，至那僕底國。
translation: From here going eastward for more than five hundred li, the Master reached the country of Navadi.

source_sentence: 詣突舍薩那寺，有大德毘膩多鉢臘婆(此云調伏光，即北印度王子)，
translation: He went to the monastery ofisesana, where there was a great virtuous monk named Vinirmita-prabha (known here as Taming Light, that is, Prince of North India).

source_sentence: 好風儀，善三藏，自造《五蘊論釋》、《唯識三十論釋》，因住十四月，
translation: He was fond of etiquette and good at the Tripiṭaka. He composed his own Commentaries on the Treatise on the Five Monas­ teries and on the Explanations of the Treatise on the Thirty Treatises of Consciousness-only, for which he lived in this country for fourteen months.

source_sentence: 學《對法論》、《顯宗論》、《理門論》等。
translation: He studied the Abhidharma-mahāprajñāpāramitā-śāstra, the Xianzong lun, the理門論, and so forth.

source_sentence: 大城東南行五十餘里，至答秣蘇伐那僧伽藍(唐言闇林)。
translation: Going southeast from the great city for more than fifty li, I reached Tamusuvana Monastery (known as Dark Forest in Chinese).

source_sentence: 僧徒三百餘人，學說一切有部。
translation: There were more than three hundred monks, all of whom studied the teachings o f the Sarvastivada school.

source_sentence: 賢劫千佛皆當於此地集人、天說法。
translation: A thousand buddhas of the good eon will all gather here to teach the Dharma to humans and gods.

source_sentence: 釋迦如來涅槃後第三百年中，有迦多衍那(舊曰迦旃延，訛也)論師，
translation: In the three hundredth year after the nirvana of the Sakyan Tathāgata, there was a śramaṇa named Kātyāyana (formerly transcribed incorrectly as kaṭyayana).

source_sentence: 於此制《發智論》。
translation: Here, he compiled the Awakening of Wisdom Treatise.

source_sentence: 從此東北行百四五十里，至闍爛達那國(北印度境)。
translation: From here going northeast for one hundred forty or fifty li, I reached the country of Jālaṃdharana (in the domain of North India).

source_sentence: 入其國，詣那伽羅馱那寺，有大德旃達羅伐摩(此云月胄)，善究三藏，
translation: He entered that country and went to the monastery of Nāgaradhana, where there lived the great virtuous Candravarman (known as Yuezhou here), who was well versed in the Tripiṭaka.

source_sentence: 因就停四月，學《眾事分毘婆沙》。
translation: He stayed there for four months and studied the Vibhāṣā council of all affairs.

source_sentence: 從此東北行登履危嶮，行七百餘里，至屈(居勿反)露多國(北印度境)。
translation: From here going northeast for more than seven hundred li on a dangerous path, I reached the country of Kuta (in the domain of northern India).

source_sentence: 自屈露多國南行七百餘里，越山濟河，至設多圖盧國(北印度境)。
translation: Going south from the country of Kukkuṭauta for more than seven hundred li, he crossed the mountains and rivers and reached the country of Śatadru (in the domain of northern India).

source_sentence: 從此西南行八百餘里，至波理夜呾羅國(中印度境)。
translation: From here going southwest for more than eight hundred li, I reached the country of Pariyatra (in the domain of Central India).

source_sentence: 從此東行五百餘里，至秣兔羅國(中印度境)。
translation: From here going eastward for more than five hundred li, I reached the country of Mathurā (in the domain of Central India).

source_sentence: 釋迦如來諸聖弟子舍利子等遺身窣堵波，謂舍利子(舊曰舍梨子，又曰舍利弗，
translation: Śāriputra (formerly transcribed as Śāriputra or Śāriputra) is a stupa consisting of the remains of all the holy disciples of the Tathāgata Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 皆訛也)、沒特伽羅子(舊曰目乾連，訛也)等塔皆現在。
translation: (These are all erroneous), the stūpas of Maudgalyāyana (formerly transcribed as Mucilinda in error) and so forth are all present.

source_sentence: 呾麗衍尼弗呾羅(唐言滿慈子，舊曰彌多羅尼子，訛略也)、優婆釐、阿難陀、羅怙羅(舊曰羅睺羅，
translation: Kālyāyana-niputra (known as Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as Maitrāyaṇīputra), Upāli, Ānanda, and Rāhula (known as Rāhula in Chinese; formerly transcribed incorrectly as Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta).

source_sentence: 又曰羅雲，皆訛也)及曼殊室利(唐言妙吉祥，舊曰濡首，又曰文殊師利，
translation: It's also called Luo Yun, which is a misnomer.) and Mañjuśrī (known as Miaojixiang (known as Mueshou in Chinese, or Mañjuśrī; formerly translated as Manjushri).

source_sentence: 又言曼殊尸利，譯曰妙德，訛也)。
translation: It's also called Mañjuśrī, translated as Marvelous Virtue, which is a mistake.)

source_sentence: 如是等諸窣堵波，每歲修福之日，僧徒相率隨所宗事而修供養。
translation: Each year on the day when they perform meritorious deeds, the monks and nuns make offerings to these stupas in accordance with the religious practice of their respective sects.

source_sentence: 阿毘達磨眾供養舍利子；
translation: The abhidharma community offered support to Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 習定之徒供養沒特伽羅子；
translation: Those who practiced meditation made offerings to Maudgalaputra.

source_sentence: 誦持經者供養滿慈子；
translation: Those who recited and preserved scriptures offered support to Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta.

source_sentence: 學毘柰耶眾供養優波釐；
translation: Upāli was attended by the Vaiśravaṇas, who studied all the teachings of Vinaya.

source_sentence: 諸比丘尼供養阿難；
translation: The bhikṣus and nuns offered support to Ānanda.

source_sentence: 未受具戒者供養羅怙羅；
translation: Those who have not received the full set of precepts should make offerings to Rāhula.

source_sentence: 學大乘者供養諸菩薩。
translation: Those who study the great vehicle make offerings to the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 城東五六里至一山伽藍，尊者烏波毱多(唐言近護)之所建也。
translation: Five or six li to the east of the city, there was a hilly monastery built by Venerable Upagupta (known as Nenghuo in Chinese).

source_sentence: 其中爪、髮舍利。
translation: Their nails and relics are preserved there.

source_sentence: 伽藍北巖有石室，高二十餘尺，廣三十餘尺，四寸細籌填積其內。
translation: On the northern cliff of the monastery there is a stone chamber more than twenty feet high and over thirty feet wide, four inches long with finely built bricks piled up inside.

source_sentence: 尊者近護說法悟道，夫妻俱證阿羅漢果者，乃下一籌；
translation: Venerable Upagupta approached the enlightenment path and preached the Dharma. The husband and wife who had both realized the fruit of arhatship offered a chip to him.

source_sentence: 單己及別族者，雖證不記。
translation: Even though it's realized and not recorded, it's only self and distinct clans that aren't included.

source_sentence: 從此東北行五百餘里，至薩他泥濕伐羅國(中印度境)。
translation: From here going northeast for more than five hundred li, I reached the country of Sthavira (in the domain of Central India).

source_sentence: 又東行四百餘里，至祿勒那國(中印度境)。
translation: Again going eastward for more than four hundred li, he reached the country of Lusena (in the domain of Central India).

source_sentence: 東臨殑伽河，北背大山，閻牟那河中境而流。
translation: It borders on the Ganges in the east and has a big mountain at its back in the north. The Jambudvīpa River flows from one side of the periphery to the other.

source_sentence: 又河東行八百餘里，至殑伽河源，廣三四里，東南流入海處廣十餘里，
translation: Again going to the east of the river for more than eight hundred li, he reached the source of the Ganges, which was three or four li in breadth and flowed southeastward into the sea more than ten li in width.

source_sentence: 其味甘美，細沙隨流。
translation: Its taste is sweet and delicious, and fine sand follows its flow.

source_sentence: 彼俗書記謂之福水。
translation: The layman's record calls it the water of merit.

source_sentence: 就中沐浴，罪舋銷除；
translation: They bathe in the water and their sins are extinguished.

source_sentence: 啜波嗽流，則殃災殄滅；
translation: If one drinks the water and coughs, all calamity will be extinguished.

source_sentence: 沒而死者，即生天受福。
translation: If someone dies after disappearing, they'll be born in heaven and receive merit.

source_sentence: 愚夫愚婦常集河濱，皆外道邪言，無其實也。
translation: Foolish men and women always gathered at the riverside, all of whom were non-Buddhist heretics who spoke falsely but did not really say so.

source_sentence: 後提婆菩薩示其正理，方始停絕。
translation: Only later did Deva Bodhisattva show him the correct principle, and then he began to stop.

source_sentence: 國有大德名闍耶毱多，善閑三藏。
translation: In that country there was a great virtuous monk named Jayagupta, well versed in the Tripitaka Master.

source_sentence: 法師遂住一冬半春，就聽經部《毘婆沙》訖。
translation: So the Master stayed there for one winter, in the middle of the spring, to listen to the finished work of the Vibhāṣā of the Sautrāntika school.

source_sentence: 渡河東岸至秣底補羅國。
translation: He crossed the river to the east bank and reached the country of Matipura.

source_sentence: 其王戍陀羅種也。
translation: The king was of the śūdra caste.

source_sentence: 伽藍十餘所，僧徒八百餘人，皆學小乘一切有部。
translation: There were more than ten monasteries with over eight hundred monks, all of whom studied the teachings o f the Sarvastivada school of the Hinayana school.

source_sentence: 大城南四五里有小伽藍，僧徒五十餘人。
translation: Four or five li to the south of the great city there was a small monastery with more than fifty monks.

source_sentence: 昔瞿拏鉢剌婆(唐言德光)論師於此作《辯真》等論，凡百餘部。
translation: Formerly the śāstra master Gotamaprabha (known as Guṇaprabha in Chinese) composed some one hundred treatises at this monastery, such as the Abhidharmacarabhumi Sastra and other treatises.

source_sentence: 論師是鉢伐多國人，本習大乘，後退學小。
translation: The śāstra master was a native of Parvata, who had studied Mahayana teachings in the past and later withdrew to study Hinayana teachings.

source_sentence: 時提婆犀那(唐言天軍)阿羅漢往來覩史多天，德光願見慈氏，決諸疑滯，
translation: At that time the arhat Devasena (known as “heavenly armies” in Chinese) came and went to the Tuṣita Heaven, wishing to see Maitreya’s family so as to resolve their doubts.

source_sentence: 請天軍以神力接上天宮。
translation: He asked the celestial army to use their supernatural powers to reach the heavenly palace.

source_sentence: 既見慈氏，揖而不禮，言：「我出家具戒，慈氏處天同俗，禮敬非宜。」
translation: When he saw Maitreya, he bowed his head and didn't venerate him, saying, I've renounced the Furniture Precepts, but Maitreya lives in heaven as a layman, so it's not appropriate to pay homage.

source_sentence: 如是往來三返，皆不致禮。
translation: They came and went like this three times but they did not pay homage to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 既我慢自高，疑亦不決。
translation: Since I am self-conceited and arrogant, my doubts are not resolved.

source_sentence: 德光伽藍南三四里有伽藍，僧二百餘人，並小乘學。
translation: Three or four li to the south of Guṇaprabha’s monastery there is another monastery with more than two hundred monks, all followers of the Hinayana teachings.

source_sentence: 是眾賢論師壽終處。
translation: This is the place where the śāstra master Samantabhadra died.

source_sentence: 論師本迦濕彌羅國人，博學高才，明一切有部《毘婆沙》。
translation: The treatise master was originally from the country of Kaśmīra. He was an erudite and highly talented scholar who taught the Vibhāṣā council of the Sarvāstivāda school.

source_sentence: 時世親菩薩亦以叡智多聞，先作《阿毘達磨俱舍論》，破毘婆沙師所執，
translation: Vasubandhu Bodhisattva also, being wise and learned, had previously composed the Abhidharmakośa-śāstra in order to refute the theories held by the Vaibhāsikas.

source_sentence: 理奧文華，西域學徒莫不讚仰，爰至鬼神亦皆講習。
translation: All the scholars of the Western Regions praised and admired his theories, even ghosts and spirits studied him as well.

source_sentence: 眾賢覽而心憤，又十二年，覃思作《俱舍雹論》二萬五千頌，八十萬言。
translation: For twelve years he composed the treatise on the Hailstorm of Kuśinagara in twenty-five thousand stanzas, eight million words.

source_sentence: 造訖，欲與世親面定是非，未果而終。
translation: When he finished the work, he wanted to give his face to Vasubandhu, who was sure it would be right or wrong, but he died before he did so.

source_sentence: 世親後見其論，歎有知解。
translation: Later, Vasubandhu saw the treatise and praised his knowledge and understanding.

source_sentence: 言其思力不減《毘婆沙》之眾也。
translation: He said, The power of his thought isn't inferior to that of the Vaibhāṣikas.

source_sentence: 雖然甚順我義，宜名《順正理論》，遂依行焉。
translation: Although it is quite consistent with the meaning of self, it should be called the Abhidharma-correct Treatise because it relies on its practice.

source_sentence: 眾賢死後，於菴沒羅林中起窣堵波，今猶見在。
translation: After the death of Samantabhadra, a stupa was built in the mango grove but it is still visible today.

source_sentence: 林側又有窣堵波，是毘末羅蜜多羅(唐言無垢稱)論師遺身處。
translation: Beside the forest is another stupa built at the place where the śāstra master Vimalamitāra (known as Wuming in Chinese) was buried.

source_sentence: 論師迦濕彌羅國人，於說一切有部出家，遊五印度，學窮三藏，將歸本國，
translation: The śāstra master Kāśmīra, a native of Kaśmīra, renounced the householder’s life and became a monk of the Sarvāstivāda school. He traveled in all five parts of India to study the Tripiṭaka thoroughly and was about to return home.

source_sentence: 塗次眾賢之塔，悲其著述未及顯揚，奄便逝歿，因自誓更造諸論，破大乘義，
translation: The stupas of Samantabhadra and Samantabhadra are coated next to each other. Sadly, his writings do not reach the point where they can be expressed in words. So he died soon after death. Because of this he vowed that he would compose more treatises to refute the theories of the Mahayana teachings.

source_sentence: 滅世親名，使論師之旨永傳遐代。
translation: He renounced his worldly reputation so that the treatise master’s theories would be transmitted from generation to generation.

source_sentence: 說此語已，心智狂亂，五舌重出，遍體血流，自知此苦原由惡見，裁書懺悔，
translation: When he had uttered these words, his mind and intellect were disturbed. His five tongues coughed out loudly and bloodshed all over his body. Knowing that this painful condition was due to bad views, he wrote a letter of repentance in which to express his remorse.

source_sentence: 勸諸同侶勿謗大乘，言終氣絕。
translation: He exhorted his fellow monks not to denigrate the Mahayana, saying that he was cutting off his breath at the end of his life.

source_sentence: 當死之處，地陷為坑。
translation: At the place where he died, the earth sank into a pit.

source_sentence: 其國有大德名蜜多斯那，年九十，即德光論師弟子，善閑三藏。
translation: In that country there was a great virtuous monk named Maitreyasena at the age of ninety. He was a disciple of the theories master Guṇaprabha and had a good time in the Tripitaka Master’s study.

source_sentence: 法師又半春一夏就學薩婆多部《怛埵三弟鑠論》(唐言《辯真論》，二萬五千頌，
translation: The Master studied the Sarvastivada Sastra (known as Bianzhen lun, “Defilation of the Truths,” in twenty-five thousand stanzas.

translation: It's also created by Guṇaprabha.) and the Treatise on the Arising of Wisdom, etc.

source_sentence: 又從此北行三百餘里，至婆羅吸摩補羅國(中印度)。
translation: From here going northward for more than three hundred li, the Master reached the country of Brahmapura (in Central India).

source_sentence: 又此東南行四百餘里，至醯掣怛羅國(中印度)。
translation: Again going southeast from here for more than four hundred li, the Master reached the country of Hetuṭala (in Central India).

source_sentence: 又南行二百餘里，渡殑伽河，西南至毘羅那拏國(中印度境)。
translation: Again going southward for more than two hundred li, he crossed the Ganges and went southwest to the country of Vārāṇasī (in the domain of Central India).

source_sentence: 又東行二百餘里，至劫比他國(中印度)。
translation: Again going eastward for more than two hundred li, he reached the country of Kapphiṇa (in Central India).

source_sentence: 城東二十餘里有大伽藍，院內有三寶階，南北列，面東西下，是佛昔於忉利天為摩耶夫人說法訖，
translation: More than twenty li to the east of the city was a great monastery built with three-jeweled staircases arranged on both south and north, facing east and west. This was the place where the Buddha had formerly preached the Dharma to Lady Maya in Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 歸贍部洲下處。
translation: They return to the lower part of Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 中是黃金，左是水精，右是白銀。
translation: The middle is made of gold, the left one of crystal, and the right one of white silver.

source_sentence: 如來起善法堂，將諸天眾躡中階而下，大梵天王執白拂，履銀階，處右，
translation: The Tathāgata rose from his seat in the Hall of Good Dharma and led the heavenly beings down the middle flight of stairs, while Mahābrahmā, holding a white whisk, walked on the silver flight of stairs to the right.

source_sentence: 天帝釋持寶蓋，蹈水精階，居左。
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra, holding a jeweled canopy, stepped onto the water spirit staircase to the left.

source_sentence: 是時百千天眾、諸大菩薩陪隨而下。
translation: At the time, a hundred thousand celestial beings and great bodhisattvas accompanied him down.

source_sentence: 自數百年前猶有階級，今並淪沒，後王戀慕，壘塼石擬其狀，飾以雜寶，
translation: Several hundred years ago there were still staircases in the old monastery, but now they have all collapsed into oblivion. The late king longed for these staircases and built a shape of them out of bricks and stones, decorated with various treasures.

source_sentence: 見高七十餘尺。
translation: It was over seventy feet in height.

source_sentence: 上起精舍，中有石佛像，左右有釋、梵之像，並倣先儀，式彰如在。
translation: A stone image of the Buddha is preserved in a temple built on the top, with images of Śākyamuni and Brahmā depicted on his left and right. All these images follow the fashions of their predecessors and are enshrined as if they were still alive.

source_sentence: 傍有石柱高七丈，無憂王所立。
translation: Beside it was a stone pillar seventy feet high, erected by King Aśoka.

source_sentence: 傍有石基，長五十餘步，高七尺。
translation: Beside it was a stone foundation more than fifty paces long and seven feet in height.

source_sentence: 是佛昔經行處。
translation: This was the place where the Buddha had walked up and down in the past.

source_sentence: 從此西北行二百里，至羯若鞠闍國(唐言曲女城。
translation: From here going northwest for two hundred li, I reached the country of Kanyākubja (known as the “Country of曲女城” in Chinese).

source_sentence: 中印度)。
translation: Central India).

source_sentence: 國周四千里，都城西臨殑伽河，長二十餘里，廣五六里。
translation: The country is four thousand li in circuit and its capital city borders the Ganges River to the west. It is over twenty li in length and five or six li in width.

source_sentence: 伽藍百餘所，僧徒萬餘人，大小俱學。
translation: There were more than a hundred monasteries with over ten thousand monks, all studying and learning at the same time.

source_sentence: 其王吠奢種也，字曷利沙伐彈那(唐言喜增)。
translation: The king was of the Vaiśravaṇa caste and his name was Kaliṣavardhana (known as Xixing in Chinese).

source_sentence: 父字波羅羯邏伐彈那(唐言作增)，先兄字遏羅闍伐彈那(唐言王增)。
translation: His father's name was Vārāṇasī (known as Zheng in Chinese), and his elder brother's name was Rājavardhana (known as Zheng in Chinese).

source_sentence: 喜增在位仁慈，國人稱詠。
translation: Joy increases in the throne, and kindness and compassion are praised by the people of the country.

source_sentence: 時東印度羯羅拏蘇伐剌那(唐言金耳)國設賞迦王(唐言同上)。
translation: It was then that the king of Kālāmasuvarṇa (known as Golden Ear in Chinese) in eastern India, King Śaśāṅkara (known as the same as above in Chinese).

source_sentence: 惡其明略而為隣患，乃誘而害之。
translation: Because he hated his insight and abstinence and became a neighbor, he was lured away and killed him.

source_sentence: 大臣婆尼(唐言明了)及群僚等，悲蒼生之無主，共立其弟尸羅阿迭多(唐言戒日)統承宗廟。
translation: The ministers, Vāṇi (known as Mingli in Chinese) and the other officials were saddened by the absence of a lord among all sentient beings and jointly established the temple of their younger brother Śīlāditya (known as Jieji in Chinese) to govern the sect.

source_sentence: 王雄姿秀傑，算略宏遠，德動天地，義感人神，遂能雪報兄讎，牢籠印度，
translation: The king’s heroic appearance was elegant and distinguished, his calculations were grand and far-reaching. His virtue moved heaven and earth and his righteousness touched the minds of men and gods. Thus he was able to repay his brother’s indebtedness by sending him into hiding in India.

source_sentence: 威風所及，禮教所霑，無不歸德。
translation: The emperor’s prestige surpassed that of his contemporaries, and the people worshipped him with reverence and veneration.

source_sentence: 天下既定，黎庶斯安，於是戢武鞱戈，營樹福業，勅其境內無得殺生，
translation: As the world was settled and the common people were peaceful, they battled with weapons and grenades to perform meritorious deeds. They ordered that no one should be allowed to kill living beings in their territory.

source_sentence: 凡厥元元普令斷肉。
translation: In the first year of his reign, he ordered them all to cut off their flesh.

source_sentence: 隨有聖迹，皆建伽藍，歲三七日遍供眾僧。
translation: Wherever there were holy sites, a monastery was built to make offerings to all the monks every three or seven days.

source_sentence: 五年一陳無遮大會，府庫所積並充檀捨，詳其所行，須達拏之流矣。
translation: On the first day of the fifth month in the Chinese year, the Buddha held an unobstructed assembly at which all the storehouses were filled with donations. The details of what they carried out became known as the stream of Sudarśana.

source_sentence: 城西北有窣堵波，高二百餘尺，東南六七里殑伽河南有窣堵波，高二百餘尺，
translation: To the northwest of the city there is a stupa more than two hundred feet in height. Six or seven li to the southeast, on the southern bank of the Ganges, there is another stupa more than two hundred feet in height.

source_sentence: 並無憂王所造，皆是佛昔說法處也。
translation: They were all made by King Aśoka, and they are all places where the Buddha preached the Dharma in the past.

source_sentence: 法師入其國，到跋達邏毘訶羅寺住三月，依毘離耶犀那三藏讀《佛使毘婆沙》、《日胄毘婆沙》訖。
translation: The Master entered that country and stayed at Bhadravihara Monastery for three months. Relying on the Tripitaka Master Vaiśinagara’s Tripitaka, he read the Vibhasa Sastra of the Buddha’s Emissary and the Vibhasa Sastra of the Sun and the Vibhasa Sastra of the Arhat in accordance with the scriptures translated by
